main.java.stock

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.stock.Stock

  • public class Stock
extends java.lang.Object
    Object used to maintain the state and any other information required about a stock. Stock can be either the store's inventory, a truck's cargo, a manifest's order for example.
    Author:
    Brandon Janson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Stock()
      Constructor used to set up the internal itemList as an empty HashMap

      Overridden method for comparing equality between Stock objects.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stock

        public Stock()
        Constructor used to set up the internal itemList as an empty HashMap

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Item item)
        Add an item to the stock
        Parameters:
        item - item to add

      • remove

        public void remove(Item item)
            throws StockException
        Remove an item from the stock. This method compares by name so these need to be equal.
        Parameters:
        item - the item object to remove
        Throws:
        StockException - if cannot find given item

      • get

        public Item get(java.lang.String itemName)
        Returns the specified item by its name
        Parameters:
        itemName - the name of the item to return
        Returns:
        the item specified by its name

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the size of the stock. Note: This is the number of item object in the Map, not the total quantity of items. I.E. it does not accommodate for the current amount of items inside the map.
        Returns:
        the size of the item list

      • adjustBy

        public void adjustBy(Stock otherStock,
                     boolean add)
              throws StockException
        Method used to adjust one stock object by another stock object. If add is true, then this stock will be increased by the given stock. If it is false, then this stock will be decreased by the given stock.
        Parameters:
        otherStock - the stock object to adjust this one by
        add - if true, otherStock will be added to this. If false, otherStock will be subtracted from this.
        Throws:
        StockException - if any item will be negative as a result of this process

      • getQuantity

        public int getQuantity()
        Returns the quantity of items in the stock. I.E. the sum of all item's current amounts.
        Returns:
        the quantity of items.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Item item)
        Wrapper method to determine if a given item exists in the stock.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to test for membership
        Returns:
        true if the item is in this stock, false if not

      • getItems

        public java.util.Collection<Item> getItems()
        Wrapper method to return the Items in the stock. Useful to prevent any access to the internal itemList.
        Returns:
        the collection of items to iterate over

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method used to display the contents of the stock object in a human-readable manner. The format is {name:current_amount, name:current_amount...}
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overridden method for comparing equality between Stock objects. This was overridden for testing purposes, but is useful for comparing Stock objects.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
